intro: Platystele ovipositoglossa, commonly known as the ovipositing tongue plant, is a rare and specialized member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, which includes a modified leaf that forms a tubular corona around the inflorescence. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically green or white in color. It is native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica and is adapted to grow in shaded, humid environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species with limited distribution.
